body:
HI @tdoublep,

Thanks for raising this. When we go through bug week, we will have a look at this. 

Best regards
Jacques

From Page 107 of "Advances in Financial Machine Learning"

> For those cases where purging is not able to prevent all leakage, we can impose
an embargo on training observations after every test set. The embargo does not
need to affect training observations prior to a test set,

The above example clearly shows a training example prior to the test set overlapping with the beginning of the test set. As stated in the OP, this is the *opposite* problem to that solved by embargo.
Yes, this is looks like what I would expect given the definition of PurgedKFold

Hi,

I ran into the same issue recently and agree with @tdoublep that this is an error. I used the same fix that he suggested.

However, I do not get the same output as @boyboi86. In the second fold (i.e. 1-th), the bold training sample should have been purged, shouldn't it? Indeed, it's an example where we have

t_(j, 0) <= t_(i, 1) <= t_(j, 1)

```
------ 1-th fold ------
>> Training events:
2020-01-01   2020-01-03
2020-01-02   2020-01-04
2020-01-03   2020-01-05
**2020-01-04   2020-01-06**
dtype: datetime64[ns]
>> Test events:
2020-01-06   2020-01-08
2020-01-07   2020-01-09
2020-01-08   2020-01-10
2020-01-09   2020-01-11
2020-01-10   2020-01-12
dtype: datetime64[ns]
```

issue.title: PurgedKFold class error (purge not working for splits)

repository.name: mlfinlab
repository.description: MlFinLab helps portfolio managers and traders who want to leverage the power of machine learning by providing reproducible, interpretable, and easy to use tools.

issue.body:
The function split on the crossvalidation.py (PurgKFold class) is not returning the right splits. The problem is on the following line:
  **test_times = pd.Series(index=[self.samples_info_sets[start_ix]], data=[self.samples_info_sets[end_ix-1]])**.

 Here, the test split used to define the train split is defined from the start to the end of the label date (2nd colloum of the samples_info_sets), where it should start on the first trading date and end on the last label date. One can fix this by replace the line above for :
**test_times = pd.Series(index=[self.samples_info_sets.index[start_ix+1]], data=[self.samples_info_sets[end_ix-1]])**
